intro: Cissarobryon elegans, commonly known as the slender liverwort, is a small, terrestrial liverwort belonging to the family Pterobryaceae. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. The plant has a thalloid structure with a dorsiventral leafy shoot, and its leaves are usually arranged in a spiral pattern. It produces spores in capsules that are borne on short stalks, and it is often found in humid climates. Due to its delicate nature, it is considered a rare and sensitive indicator of environmental health.
